articles.title: Tactical Breach Wizards review: humour, heart, smarts and playfulness conjure up an instant genre classic

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Please lock your Chocobos to attack position and set your Phoenix Downs to stun: Square Enix have released fresh details of Final Fantasy 16's PC port, which has now been dated for launch on 17th September. They've also shared a little about why it's taken so long to arrive - the (generally decent) action-RPG hit PS5 over a year ago, back when I was still some filthy console-playing freelancer.
According to director Hiroshi Takai, it was "impossible" to create the PC and PS5 versions at the same time, even if Square Enix hadn't been restrained by a timed exclusivity clause. He also thinks that the Final Fantasy series faces no "existential risk" right now, despite lower-than-hoped returns from both Final Fantasy 16 and, going by Square Enix's latest financial reports, the more recent and currently PS5-only Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth.
 Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy faces no "existential risk" despite lower-than-hoped PS5 sales, says FF16 director

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Silent Hill has a messy, up-is-down relationship with time and history, so let's go about this hands-on with the Silent Hill 2 Remake in a messy, up-is-down way. Developed well over two decades ago, the original Silent Hill 2 is the magnum opus of Polish horror stalwarts Bloober Team. Running on then-innovative "Unreal Engine 5" technology created by Jazz Jackrabbit publishers Epic MegaGames, it's a wonderful abyss of a game that remains perfectly playable today, given a certain amount of tolerance for the quirks of the era.
It begins with your character, James Sunderland, descending from the road towards the eponymous Midwestern nowhere-town. Like many games of the period, Silent Hill 2 uses a third-person, over-the-shoulder manual camera, which allows you to glance fearfully up at the monstrous pine trees that fringe the path - each rising from a bulging tide of fog that menaces with the suggestion of approaching figures. There is moisture everywhere, gushing from drain pipes and dribbling down concrete barriers. As you amble into the murk, deathly chords and groaning, unmechanical motifs reverberate from somewhere deep underground. 
 
Read more
articles.title: After three hours of Bloober's Silent Hill 2, it's unclear who is remaking who

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I’ve likely mentioned hitting Lovecraft fatigue so often that it’s now evolved into a second phase of Lovecraft-fatigue fatigue. This is not the same as Lovecraft refreshment, no matter how much I might want to return to the days before old one plushies and Cthulhu children’s books terrorised the internet en masse. There’s not quite enough information about “story generator” sim Marry a Deep One: Innsmouth Simulator for me to confidently say it’ll cut through my exhaustion with all things tentacular and horrifically be-gilled. But it is beguiling, isn’t it? There’s all sorts of little widgets and details shown off that remind me of everything from Sid Meier’s Pirates to classic adventure games, and maybe even a little Rimworld? It’s a heady soup, although one I’d recommend against quaffing, given where the water comes from.
Read more
articles.title: A lovely, not-at-all culty seaside day out awaits in “Story generator” sim Marry a Deep One: Innsmouth Simulator

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
One of the best roguelikes on PC is getting a farewell of sorts this week. Twitchy slashfest Dead Cells received its final major update, introducing new enemies, fresh weapons, and a few mutations. Unfortunately, all this new stuff is very cursed. In other words, it all toys with the game's "curse" status effect, a hex that causes you to be killed if you take even a single hit. You'll probably die a few times as a result of this update, which in some ways is a fitting finalé for this fast-paced jar smasher of a game. You can see the new features in the trailer below. 
Read more
articles.title: Dead Cells gets its final update after 8 years of development, bringing it to a cursed close

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Last week, the Xitter account for H2M - a mod aiming to recreate the heyday of classic Modern Warfare 2 multiplayer inside Call of Duty: Modern Warfare Remastered - announced that they had received a cease and desist from Activision Blizzard, and would shut down the project. The 2022 version of Modern Warfare 2 lacked the original’s multiplayer, and H2M was so highly-anticipated that Steam sales of the 2016 FPS balooned in the lead-up to the mod’s planned release date. It didn't hurt that Activision had it on sale, of course, but the timing lined up so well that some fans speculated the discount was a deliberate bait-and-switch on the publisher’s part to profit from excitement over a mod they were already planning to shut down.
Read more
articles.title: Activision shut down Modern Warfare multiplayer mod H2M to stop it "interfering" with Black Ops 6 sales, says mod maker

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
New week, same old terror of that cyclopean glutton known as the Maw emerging from its cosmic bolthole and swallowing the entirety of Devon. As ever, we have a way of thwarting the Maw's advance, and it's... pasta sauce? Graham, why is there pasta sauce in the Trello? Have Ziff Davis subfranchised us to Dolmio? Oh, I'm sorry! That's just my shopping list. What I meant to say was: new video games! Video games (PC games, specifically) are the only thing that can preoccupy the Maw, the only thing newsworthy enough to distract it from the tempting clifftop maisonettes of Torquay. Let's see what the week has in store for us, eh.
 Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
When Bloober and Konami announced that they were remaking Silent Hill 2 as part of a comprehensive series reboot, it made immediate if slightly deflating sense to me. Silent Hill 2 is the more feted of the Hills - if I were a calculating franchise custodian tasked with 'bringing back' one of the acclaimed original trilogy, that's probably the instalment I and my spreadsheets would fix upon. I mean, it's the game with Pyramid Head in it - the nearest thing Silent Hill has to a mascot, and it's not like there's an issue of cutting out plot material: each game in the Silent Hill series is, on some level, a distinct story with a distinct protagonist.
Still, the decision to 'skip' the first game in the series, whose world, narrative themes, music and art direction set the parameters for all the rest, made my brain itch a bit, and when I ran into Bloober's creative director Mateusz Lenart and lead producer Maciej Głomb at a Konami event, I had to ask about it. 
 
Read more
articles.title: Why didn't Silent Hill 2 Remake studio Bloober start by remaking Silent Hill 1? The devs explain

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! You know books, right? They’re like RPS articles, but slightly better for piling under a flock mat to make little hills for your plastic spacemen. Fitting, then, that this week it’s plastic spaceman enthusiast, writer on Absolver, Nightingale, Gladius, and Total War: Warhammer 3, and Ten Things Video Games Can Teach Us author, Dan Griliopoulos! Cheers Dan! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf?
Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Nightingale, Absolver, and Total War: Warhammer writer Dan Griliopoulos

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are for cat. I’m currently in the process of acquiring a gorgeous white and ginger kitten for the local shelter. I have seen four seconds of footage and I’m already smitten, kitten. Before I spend the weekend getting very excited about big stretches, let’s read this week’s best writing about games (and game related things!)
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
JDM: Rise Of The Scorpion is a free prologue for JDM: Japanese Drift Master, a racing game about - who could guess - drift racing in Japan. It's got an open world set in rural towns to burn rubber around as well as several story missions to play. You can download it from Steam now.

 
Read more
articles.title: JDM: Rise Of The Scorpion offers a free prologue of drift racing around rural Japan

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I've got a real soft spot for Trombone Champ, a rhythm game about tooting along to music that works perfectly with the mouse. I'm also a huge fan of Beat Saber, a rhythm game in which you slice at blocks that whizz towards you in VR.

You can see where this is going. Trombone Champ: Unflattened transports that 2022 tooting into 2024 virtual reality.

 
Read more
articles.title: Trombone Champ: Unflattened brings the tooting simulator to virtual reality this autumn

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Minecraft's Realms servers have been down for most of the past four days. Mojang's official account for reporting service status updates noted that "intermittent failures or slowdowns" began on August 13th, and despite similarly intermittent reports of uptime in the days since, the servers remain inaccessible to most players today.

 
Read more
articles.title: Minecraft's multiplayer Realms servers have been down since its last patch over three days ago

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
Good job, everyone! The cat talk in the comments has never been stronger. I miss my cats back in England very much. Though I did visit a cat cafe recently, and I got to boop some sphinx kittens on the nose. Life pretty much peaked then, so I'm in a bit of a slump right now. So do me a favour and sound off even more than usual about what your fur babies have been up to lately! And also, if you feel like it, let us know what you're playing this weekend too. Here's what we're clicking on!
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Baroque wilderness-builder Nightingale has not been doing brilliantly since Ed Thorn described the launch early access version as "a numbers grind disguised as a gaslamp survival game". We had moderately high hopes for it before the early access release - I personally enjoy the fairytale setting, with its pop-up Pucks and magic umbrellas, but I also think I've raised enough hovels on procedurally generated maps for one lifetime. Still, I'd quite like it to come good, if only so I can justify op-eds about Lewis Carroll, and I'm somewhat encouraged by what I've heard of the game's forthcoming Realms Rebuilt update. 
 Read more
articles.title: Troubled fairytale sim Nightingale is getting a Realms Rebuilt update that trades procgen for "handcrafted" story worlds

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
There you are, rambling through the woods of Interactive Entertainment with an empty pack and a spring in your step. Here I am, lying in wait behind a tree. Wham! Bam! You reel back in consternation as I bounce into the path and clobber you with a sack containing no less than eight venerable RPGs, from Baldur's Gate to Warhammer 40,000: Rogue's Trader - well over a thousand hours worth of dungeons, dragons, dicerolls, dwarven shopkeepers and many other things I refuse to spend time alliterating, all of which will (currently) set you back just £32.07. 


Were you planning to spend this weekend playing some cute two-hour artgame sideshow, without any levelling at all? Shut up, you DOLT. You will play what the nice journalist tells you to play! Best lay in extra caffeine tablets, because it's going to take you till Monday just to get through the character creators alone.

 
Read more
articles.title: From Baldur's Gate to Rogue Trader, the latest RPG-themed Humble Bundle is a horrifying assault on your time

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Black Myth: Wukong is an action RPG that leans a bit into the Souls camp and a bit into the adventure camp. And either way, it's a spectacular journey that works for mostly everyone: those after challenging fights against Chinese mythological creatures, and those after the same thing, but with a little less challenge than your typical Soulslikes. What separates Black Myth from the crowd, though, is its slick presentation and a sense of generosity. You're to witness the most lavish, cinematic worlds and its creatures. And you're to enjoy battering everything with your staff as a highly athletic monkey with copious spells at his furry follicles and fingertips. It's been a while since I've played anything quite as impressive as this.
Read more
articles.title: Black Myth: Wukong review: a refreshing adventure after Elden Ring's knotty DLC

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Unlike Ed, I wasn’t deemed important or youthfully handsome enough to get Black Myth: Wukong review code, leaving my only hopes of conducting some hardwarey performance investigation with the recently released benchmarking tool. The one that, by the admission of developers Game Science themselves, "may not fully represent the actual gaming experience and final performance at the time of the game's release". Monkey nuts.
Read more
articles.title: Let’s beat some usefulness out that Black Myth: Wukong benchmark tool

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Crytek's sweaty and superlative survival boss-rush shooter Hunt: Showdown has been relaunched as Hunt: Showdown 1896, introducing a comprehensive technological update alongside a chronological leap forward to a new map in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado. As is tradition for big 2.0-style updates, some players absolutely loathe it, with recent Steam user reviews dragging the consensus underwater.
Read more
articles.title: Hunt Showdown's 1896 relaunch is live and facing player derision over the new UI, bugs and performance

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Any gags I could make about an update that lets Total War: Warhammer 3’s dawi play tall are far too obvious for the discerning comedic palette that brought you such bangers as that time I just wrote “(penis)” a bunch so the Overkill’s Walking Dead page wouldn’t quote me out of context, so let’s just dive right in to the details. The strategy game’s 5.2 update is on the horizon, and tagging along with it are the first of the “extra bits” the team teased in June. I’m very excited about them. They sit somewhere between the usual patch fare of stat tweaks and errata, and the weightier faction facelifts that come alongside paid DLC. They’re also focused right where Immortal Empires needs them the most: depth, rather than width. In the dawi’s case, quite literally.
 
Read more
articles.title: The next Total War: Warhammer 3 update will let your dwarves play tall by delving greedily and deep

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The mountain biking of Lonely Mountains: Downhill was sometimes a relaxing ride down gentle slopes, and at other times a hairy hurtle down declivitous cliffs. Alongside the likes of the Descenders and Riders Republic, it offered a more laid-back game, open to furious time trialling but always remembering to let you stop and appreciate the view. Both the stakes and the poly count were low. Happy news then, that it is getting a snowy sequel. In Lonely Mountains: Snow Riders you'll be swapping your bike for a pair of skis, and you'll be able to barrel down the mountainside with friends in co-op.
Read more
articles.title: Mellow mountain biker Lonely Mountains: Downhill is getting a wintry sequel about skiing

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
For years, our PC storage has wobbled and buckled beneath the tyranny of gigantic Call Of Duty installs. Like 13th century peasants straining to convey huge, teetering loads of freshly quarried LMGs, our SSDs cry out for justice. Perhaps scenting imminent rebellion and a mass audience desertion to low-poly shooters with more civilised file sizes, Activision have relented. Future installations of the much-padded FPS will be "smaller and more customised", though in a last cruel stroke of villainy, they want you to download a large update to prepare the ground.
 Read more
articles.title: Activision are finally cutting down Call Of Duty's horrendous install sizes for Black Ops 6's release

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Life sim contender Inzoi is hoping to knock The Sims from its perch when it launches (supposedly) later this year. There will soon be an opportunity to judge whether that feat is likely. Krafton have announced that they're releasing a time-limited trial of Inzoi's character creator next week on August 20th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Inzoi begins its fight for The Sims' crown with a time-limited character creator trial on August 20th

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I am forever looking for a game to replace Transport Tycoon (or OpenTTD) in my affections. I know there are several railway management sims kicking around Steam, but I haven't found the one that does it for me yet. Could it be Railroad Corporation 2? It's a train tycoon game in which you lay tracks through the early 20th century, and it's launching in Early Access on September 9th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Railroad Corporation 2 will begin laying track in front of its moving Early Access train on September 9th

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The Plucky Squire stars a 2D sword-slashing protagonist so plucky he busts out of his storybook confines and into the fully 3D world of a kid's bedroom. You'll then spend your time hopping between these various planes on a grand, cartoon adventure.

It now has a release date: September 17th.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Plucky Squire will bust from the pages of the release date calendar on September 17th

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The management game progression chart is supposed to go: zoo, then theme park, then hospital, then school. Apparently no one told Springloaded Software, who are following up their 2021 tycoon 'em up Let's Build A Zoo with a game about building an MMO. 

Let's Build A Dungeon marries the business aspects of Game Dev Tycoon with a more hands-on approach to constructing your company's game, and there's a first trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Let's Build A Dungeon is a management game about running a dev studio and designing your own subscription MMO

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Space 4X strategy game Stellaris launched in 2016, but Paradox can't stop adding to the universe. Last time I checked in, it was school trips to other dimensions. Now, it's Cosmic Storms. Due for release alongside the Stellaris 3.13 Vela update on September 10th, these are a paid "mechanical expansion" (priced at a rather chunky £11, $13 or €13, and available as part of the current season pass) that builds upon the game's existing Space Storms, "providing a deeper experience with strategically meaningful gameplay and beautiful upgraded visuals". Wash that down with new civics, precursor narratives, anomalies, archaeology sites, techs, edicts, a new Ascension perk, and new galactic community resolutions.
 Read more
articles.title: Stellaris turns Twister with new Cosmic Storms you can bend to your will

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you relished the splashier gunfights of Cyberpunk 2077, like the sound of Doom meets Blade Runner, or wish you could jam your nose right into the neon trenches of Ruiner, you will likely enjoy the announcement trailer for Defect. It's a new "cyberpunk, squad-based, Immersive Objective Shooter" from emptyvessel, a team of erstwhile id Software, Call Of Duty and Naughty Dog folks. 
 Read more
articles.title: Defect is a very loud cyberpunk "immersive shooter" from ex-Call Of Duty, Doom and Naughty Dog devs

articles.author: Kiera Mills
articles.description:
Tiny Glade is a relaxing, wholly escapist building sim where you can kick back and summon villages, cottages and castles whilst listening to whimsical tunes without the worry of combat or busywork. This cosy game has received a lot of attention, becoming the fourth most-played demo during Steam Next Fest and earning a place within our own list of favourite demos. It now has a release date - 23rd September 2024.
Read more
articles.title: Cosy building game Tiny Glade finally has a release date, plus ducks

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
In the grim heatwave of the midsummer, everyone you know would love to come hunch over a table and roll dice for six hours, actually, but they’ve got that thing on. You remember that thing, right? Plus, no-one’s got a big enough table. Or the new errata. Also, Trevor’s been banging on about lady Custodes for five months straight and nobody wants to be around him right now. Thank the Omni-trevor, then, for the three-player co-op of Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2. “Warhammer with the boys?” said Horace as he stretchily dished out preview keys from an entirely different postcode. James, Edwin and Nic were initially all booked-up for the week, but Horace repeated himself, making it absolutely clear that it wasn’t a question.
 
Read more
articles.title: Space Marine 2’s co-op suggests it is in fact jetpacks that make the dream work

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Earlier this week there was some minor Discourse about the removal of the Erotica photography tag from the Dead Rising remaster. Some readers characterised this as a familiar species of cultural hypocrisy regarding video games - emphasising violence is A-OK, but for the love of god, don't mention sex. Good news, those people: Dread XP's latest horror signing The Lacerator has both. It casts you as hirsute 1980s porn star Max - surname not given in press release, but presumably something like Jackin' or Girth - who has been abducted by a large scary individual called the Lacerator.
 Read more
articles.title: In retro gorefest The Lacerator there are as many solutions as you have limbs to lose

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I was all set to plunge into Blackbird and Gearbox's Homeworld 3 this spring when I received a slightly underwhelmed intergalactic transmission from Nic, praising the game's atmosphere and story while ruminating over fussy controls and a want of tactical depth. Like a herd of frigates scenting a pride of destroyers lurking behind a nearby asteroid, I rerouted hastily and took up a holding position approximately one astronomical unit from the Buy button, hoping that the developers might iron out a few of the wrinkles. 
 Read more
articles.title: Homeworld 3's latest free update and paid DLC probably won't fix its negative Steam reception

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
Over 2000 hours spent in various factory games makes me a bit of a purist, I suppose. In theory, I should then be the ideal reviewer to enjoy Shapez 2. But I'm also the ideal reviewer to tear it apart over the most minor hiccups and defects. I'm the Anton Ego of factory games. I don't like food, I love it. If I don't love it, I don't swallow.
Ah, you needn't worry. This is by far the most fun I've had reviewing a game, and Shapez 2 has, in my mind at least, turned the holy trinity of factory games (Factorio, Satisfactory, Dyson Sphere Program) into a holy quartet. Its pared back, everything-is-free-forever approach is quite liberating, and I've never had so much fun placing conveyor belts in my life. But 40 hours into my save file, I've often found myself yearning for a bit more creativity in the challenges, a few more curveballs sent in my direction.
 Read more
articles.title: Shapez 2 early access review: splendid abstract factory-building with room for a few more surprises

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
It’s an oddly Halloweeny summer week for games, this one. Dragon Age: The Veilguard’s October 31st release date leaked earlier, Steam have put together a Summer Fright Night bundle featuring RPS fave Hauntii, and I’ve got a strange urge to gorge on Haribo and mini Double Deckers until blood comes out of my eyeballs. What a perfect time, then, to dive into the alpha demo for vampire management game Blood Bar Tycoon, especially since Two Point seem to be resting on their laurels a bit too comfortably for my liking.
The idea here is you build a swanky bar serving claret cosmopolitans, ichor-ish coffees and uh, viscera vampiros to your undead clientele. But (with the sorta exception of the crimson-sapped Dracaena cinnabari) blood doesn’t grow on trees, so you’ll also be moonlighting as a human-nabber. You’ll research a slew of “whacky contraptions” to extract their blood, which I greatly enjoy, because “zany exsanguination” is a real winner of a feature. You can’t frivolously phlebotomise with impunity, however - you’ll also want to be on the lookout for vampire hunters aka the fun police.
 
Read more
articles.title: I'll serve my Blood Bar Tycoon customers when I'm through dumping exsanguinated bodies down the sewer

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Put your mortar and pestle down, my herb-smooshing friend. The peasant-quelling RPG antics of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 won't be releasing this year after all, say developers Warhorse  in a video message to fans. "We aimed for the end of the year, and almost made it," said PR man Tobi Stolz-Zwilling. "Almost is not good enough though, so unfortunately we slipped to 2025."  Never mind, it's easy to slip in the medieval era. There was mud everywhere.
Read more
articles.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 delays its medieval RPG hustling until early next year

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The release date for Dragon Age: The Veilguard has been revealed in a last-minute leak thanks to a naughty video advertisement. Electronic Arts had planned to share the game's debut-day in about... *checks watchless wrist* ... 7 hours, as part of a special release date trailer. But the internet will ever internet, and thanks to some slip-up or other, we have the knowledge just a smidge early. Will I tell you what the actual release date is? Sure. I guess so.
Read more
articles.title: Oops... the release date for Dragon Age: The Veilguard leaks a few hours early

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Steam’s seeing a good few sweeping changes of late. They’ve recently added a ‘Trending Free’ tab to separate the no money down and no, money down playables. And, as of September, they’re cracking down on links to other websites in store pages. Now, horror of horrors, they’re coming for your ascii gigachads and “nobody is going to read this review so I’ll just say I’m gay” bangers. The changes are part of their ‘New Helpfulness System’, outlined here.
The new system, which will be enabled by default but can be toggled off, aims to “help potential players make informed decisions about the games they are considering purchasing by understanding the attributes of the game that other players like or don't like.” Ah, so a sort of ‘review’, if you will. I like it!
 
Read more
articles.title: Steam’s latest update to user reviews doesn’t find your “jokes, memes, ascii art and other content” as funny as you do

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The Bullfroggy connected universe that is Two Point County continues to expand with the announcement of Two Point Museum, another irreverent management sim from developers Two Point Studios. This one’s about museums, would you believe, with exhibition themes including the world of prehistory. Find a trailer propped below this paragraph like a freshly brushed-down Tugowaurus skeleton.
 
Read more
articles.title: Two Point Museum announced with trailer full of breakable dinosaurs and reheated cavemen

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Vroom vroom. That is the sound of 11 rivals revving their engines as they blink the sweat out of their eyes and exhale years of self-doubt from their lungs. Today is their day. We have lined up these racing games on a starting grid and are interested to see how things shake out. Will the realism-obsessed driving sims take the lead with their sublime physics engines? Might the futuristic combat racers simply destroy the opposition with explosive rockets? Or perhaps a nippy arcade crowd-pleaser will soar to the finish line, propelled by the sound of roaring cheers. It's all to play for here at our incredibly messed-up grand prix with a worrying lack of rules or regulation. Start your engines, everyone, these are the 11 best racing games on PC. 3! 2! 1! ... 

 
Read more
articles.title: The 11 best racing games on PC

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The next advance in video game graphics technology is not ray-tracing or tray-racing or any variation thereof - it's janky stop motion and rubbish plastic dolls, and it actually began about 30 years ago, when I watched the Adam and Joe show for the first time. If you never watched the Adam and Joe show, they used to do home movie recreations of famous films like Titanic and Saving Private Ryan using stuffed animals and action figures. I found these "Toymovies" hysterical as a kid - I suspect they are less so now. Probably, they are full of jokes we might tentatively class as "of their time". The point is, Reptilian Rising is sort of Toymovie: The Game. 
 Read more
articles.title: Reptilian Rising is an enjoyably naff toy-based tactics game featuring Spartacus, St George and Einstein

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
The Crimson Diamond is a proper old-school style puzzle adventure. It's 2D pixel art, with a limited colour palette as in EGA games, and you control it with a text parser, like King's Quest or one of them other Sierra adventures old men like Graham remember. It's important to mention this up front because it's very possible that, despite The Crimson Diamond's tale of betrayal, murder, and mineral rights in 1914 Canada, the text parser element will be a Rubicon you instantly can't be arsed to cross. A not unreasonable stance - though I think the text parser in The Crimson Diamond is fantastic. Such beef that I have with this adventure game is down to the specificity required to solve some of the puzzles.
Read more
articles.title: The Crimson Diamond review: an enthralling retro-inspired EGA game with modern mystery style

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
KIBORG: Arena feels like a throwback in several ways that I quite enjoy. It’s a free prologue to the upcoming cyberpunk puncher KIBORG. The titular arena is a large room in which you, a large man, bash a large amount of enemies. You have to punch a gong between waves to trigger the next, and this struck me as a nice pre-emptive nudge that every problem you face in Kiborg can be solved by rapidly moving your fist towards offending objects, which turned out not to be too far off the mark.
 
Read more
articles.title: KIBORG: Arena is a free slice of Arkham-style combat starring a John Protagonist-ass punchy cyborg

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Satirical space RPG sequel The Outer Worlds 2 was announced back in 2021. Since then, we've heard nary a peep about it, with developers Obsidian focusing on Pillars Of Eternity successor Avowed and their ace survival game Grounded, which left early access in September 2022. According to Obsidian's studio head Feargus Urquhart, the project is rubbing along nicely. But it was not ever thus: during the opening years of the Covid pandemic, there was apparently "talk of 'do we stop Outer Worlds 2 and just throw the whole team on Avowed'."

 
Read more
articles.title: Outer Worlds 2 is looking "incredible", says Obsidian boss, but they did consider "throwing the whole team on Avowed"

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Valve have made no secret of their plans to make SteamOS – the Linux-based operating system that powers the Steam Deck – available to other games-playing devices, including rival handhelds. After a recent beta update mentioned adding support for the Asus ROG Ally’s inputs, The Verge confirmed with Valve that SteamOS support for non-Steam Deck portables is still very much in the works. The Deck’s long-promised dual booting capability, on the other hand, sounds further down the to-do list.
Read more
articles.title: Valve are still taking SteamOS beyond the Steam Deck, though dual booting is a ways off

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
It’s been looking grim for Super Earth recently. I mean, not really. Multiplayer shooty Helldivers 2 is still sitting around 35,000 concurrent players, which is perfectly respectable, if only around 10% of its peak back in April. Still, a clutch of disgruntled ‘divers have recently found a novel way to protest an increasingly unpopular series of nerfs: laying down their guns and letting the bots take the damn planet.
“If Super Earth wanted to remain safe, they would stop nerfing our guns," reads one comment on the subreddit, in response to a post titled “Let the bots advance. Let the Super Earth burn.” It seems to have picked up some steam inside the actual game, too. As of earlier this week, there’s only around a thousand players actively trying to stop the bots advancing perilously close to the home planet, via Gamesradar.
Whether this is all massively overblown for the sake of a dramatic yarn or not, Arrowhead themselves have taken note of player concerns over nerfs. Yesterday, game director Mikael Eriksson unveiled a plan for the next 60 days, directly addressing player feedback over the controversial ‘Escalation of Freedom’ update.
 
Read more
articles.title: Arrowhead emerge with a bullet-pointed peace offering to pacify mutinous Helldivers 2 players

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Finding and sharing Free Stuff is one of the time-honoured duties of the video game journalist or SEO-monger. Back when I was OXM's online editor, "free Xbox games" was one of our golden Google pillars, the other two being "Minecraft Xbox 360 update" and "Skyrim something something". Well, uncle Valve has just rudely torpedoed that ancient investigative initiative by adding a Trending Free tab to the Steam frontpage, encompassing prologues, demos, free-to-play games and that most treasured of jewels, a full free game with no monetisation elements, such as Grimhook.
Do not cry for us pitiful electronic scribblers, crowded on our melting internet icebergs. Play free games instead! Thanks to that new tab, I've just discovered a demo for neato wide-format tower defender Frontline Crisis. Hah, that'll keep the awareness of steady livelihood erosion at bay.
 Read more
articles.title: Steam now has a Trending Free tab for demos, full free games and free-to-play

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Aside from being a game where you run around a shopping mall murdering the living dead, the original Dead Rising from 2006 is a clownish satire of sleazy tabloid photojournalism. It expresses this by way of its scoring system, where you earn "Prestige points" for snapping pictures that fit one of five categories: "Brutal" scenes of characters being slain; moments of "Horror", such as the spectacle of an approaching horde; comical "Outtakes", like characters caught in bizarre poses; moments of "Drama", such as people reacting to discoveries; and "Erotic" photos of women alive or undead, which range from snaps of exposed underwear to close-ups of cleavage.
The Erotica tag has, however, been chopped from the Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster, in what Capcom gingerly suggest isn't "a response to a changing cultural climate", but expressive of the view that earning points from such photos is not "an appropriate reward for survival and not a skill required of a journalist trying to stay alive".
 Read more
articles.title: The Dead Rising remaster no longer gives you points for "Erotica" creepshots because it's not "required" or "appropriate"

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
The Steam Deck’s competitors, whether they’re the old guard Ayaneo family, the luxe Asus ROG Ally X, or the shapeshifting Lenovo Legion Go, usually share the same attack line: they can play more of your games. The Deck’s compatibility issues aren’t nearly as issue-some as they were at launch, but between its Linux-based SteamOS and its relatively mild processing power, but it is true that beefier Windows handhelds will more likely cater to your entire cross-launcher library.
Unless, that is, you get something else to run them for you. Streaming games on the Steam Deck has emerged as a nifty workaround for the portable PC’s lingering compatibility woes, making even officially unsupported games playable. Usually with much better performance, too, as the actual rendering work is done remotely – what you see on the Deck’s screen is basically a video feed of that remote device’s display output, with your control input beamed the other way via a low-latency connection. And because you’re not using SteamOS or the internal hardware to actually run the game, it’s not bound by their limits.
Read more
articles.title: Even with some annoyances, game streaming can feel like a Steam Deck cheat code

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I'm no shoot 'em up nutter - or "shmutter", as I understand they prefer to be called - but some of the first games I remember playing are shmups. Games like Maelstrom, Ambrosia's Macintosh clone of Asteroids, and the proto-shmup Crystal Quest from Patrick Buckland, who would go on to make Carmageddon. Little did I know that the humble premise of a small 2D spacecraft shooting baddies on a wrap-around screen would reach the glittering heights of Nova Drift. Had you shown me this game back in 1995, I dare say I'd have shmupped myself.
 
Read more
articles.title: Arcade shooter Nova Drift is a Petri dish in which to spawn the daftest, deadliest spaceship

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nové funkce v Calcu,lepší podpora OOXML, vylepšené rozhraní Impressu jsou některé z novinek letní verze kancelářského balíku LibreOffice 24.8. Co dalšího pro nás vývojáři připravili?
articles.title: LibreOffice 24.8 se loučí s Windows 7 a 8, vylepšuje podporu GTK

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Dokončíme popis problematiky modelů provádějících regresní analýzu. Ukážeme si, jak tyto modely natrénovat, jak zjistit, které atributy způsobují špatné předpovědi modelu i to, jak zjistit atributy způsobující nestabilitu předpovědí.
articles.title: Balíček scikit-learn: trénink a předpovědi modelů provádějících regresní analýzu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Ondřej Caletka)
articles.description: Nejnovější verze OpenSSH automaticky blokuje hádání hesel. Funkce je navíc automaticky zapnutá. V článku se podíváme na to, jak přesně blokování funguje, jak se dá jeho chování nastavit a zda automatická aktivace nové funkce může představovat problém.
articles.title: OpenSSH má vlastní obranu proti hádání hesel. Jak přesně funguje?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Pravidelná středeční sonda do světa software. Dnes se podíváme na zrobustněné Malování, necháme si vygenerovat titulky z videa a nakonec vyzkoušíme GUI pro emulátory služeb z Google Cloud Platform.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (21. 8. 2024): vylepšené Malování s umělou inteligencí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Dnes si popíšeme pokročilejší grafické operace podporované kartou VGA, které dokáží ušetřit práci CPU. Jedná se o horizontální i vertikální scrolling, podporu pro double i tripple buffering a taktéž o režim rozdělené obrazovky.
articles.title: Grafické operace přímo podporované čipy karty VGA

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: ČD - Telematika)
articles.description: Dnes se podíváme na nově vydané šifrovací standardy NIST, statistiky DDoS útoků za první pololetí roku 2024, potenciální kyberšpionáž v Rusku a zranitelnosti v produktech od Microsoftu.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: kvantové šifrování, rekordní DDoS útoky a nové zranitelnosti

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Redox OS představil nový webový server a schopnost vytvářet binární soubory. Vývojáři Debianu vylepšují a zrychlují správce balíčků APT. Vydání Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS muselo být odloženo kvůli objevení řady chyb.
articles.title: Redox OS má webový server, Debian vylepšuje APT

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Podpora AMD Smart Data Cache Injection, KDE a správa barev na Waylandu, Ubuntu s X.Org v samostatném balíčku, TI postaví továrny za miliardy,
articles.title: Kim Dotcom bude vydán do USA, herní engine Godot s podporou Waylandu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Desítky dílčích testů ilustrují jedno: AMD s novým Ryzenem 9 9950X opět odskakuje Intelu i sama sobě a posouvá hranice možného o notný kus vpřed. Podívejme se na celý velký test v souvislostech.
articles.title: AMD Ryzen 9 9950X: test potvrdil nového krále PC světa

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Lukáš Kotek)
articles.description: Provozovat FreeDOS ve virtuálním stroji už umíme. Následující text popisuje retro notebook Pocket 386, zprovoznění FreeDOSu na něm a množství drobných tipů a triků nejen ohledně české lokalizace.
articles.title: Pocket 386: FreeDOS na malém notebooku se spoustou konektorů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na stránkách nové nápovědy o nastavení Windows 10 a 11 se o ovládacích panelech dozvíte:
articles.title: Microsoft se připravuje na vyřazení ovládacích panelů z Windows

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V San Franciscu mají autonomní auta bez řidiče Waymo, která slouží jako taxi. Tato auta zaplňovala parkoviště v blízkosti obytných budov a přitom na sebe navzájem troubila.
articles.title: Taxi bez řidiče na sebe troubila v San Franciscu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Kankys)
articles.description: Dnes distribuce EndeavourOS slaví 5 let od svého vzniku. Tato distribuce začala svou cestu jako náhrada za již zaniklou distribuci Antegros (dříve Cinnarch).
articles.title: Distribuce EndeavourOS slaví 5 let

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Po úterní aktualizaci Windows přestal některým uživatelům fungovat dual-boot do Linuxu. SecureBoot hlásí „Verifying shim SBAT data failed: Security Policy Violation“. Aktualizace Microsoftu řeší dva roky staré přetečení v Grubu CVE-2022–2601, které by mohlo potenciálně být zneužito k obejití Secure-boot.
articles.title: Po aktualizaci Windows přestal fungovat dual-boot Linuxu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nový AI pomocník do Windows 11 Recall má za úkol zaznamenávat vše, co uživatel na počítači dělá. A to tak, že zaznamenává snímky obrazovky a přepisuje mluvené slovo ve videokonferencích či videích. Recall se však setkal s negativní odezvou u uživatelů, kteří se obávají o své soukromí. Microsoft nejprve vylepšil šifrování, vypnul Recall ve výchozím stavu a pak odložil Recall na neurčito.
articles.title: Kontroverzní Recall ve Windows 11 to zkusí znovu v říjnu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Apache je jeden z nejrozšířenějších a nejpoužívanějších webových server současnosti, na školení Web server Apache se ho naučíme instalovat, spravovat a ladit pro co nejhladší běh našich služeb. Vše si vyzkoušíte prakticky na ostrém serveru, na kterém budete mít možnost provozovat skutečný web a ovlivňovat jeho nastavení.
articles.title: Naučte se používat web server Apache (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Podle nejnovějších údajů společnosti StatCounter dosáhl Linux v červenci 2024 na desktopech celosvětově podílu 4,45 %. Windows jsou na 72,08 % a macOS na 14,92 %. Před rokem byl přitom podíl Linuxu 3,12 % a na začátku letošního roku se podíl přehoupl přes 4 %. Do této hodnoty se nepočítá ChromeOS, což je sice taky Linux, ale ve statistice má svou vlastní kolonku s 1,41 %.
articles.title: Linux je na 4,45 % desktopů, hlásí statistiky StatCounter

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V rámci iniciativy Scalable Video Technology (SVT) vyvíjel Intel nástroj SVT-HEVC, což je jako vysoce výkonný kodér videa H.265/HEVC s licencí BSD optimalizovaný pro procesory Xeon Scalable a Xeon D. Projekt však byl oficiálně ukončen, což se nyní také píše na jeho githubovém účtu.
articles.title: Intel ukončil projekt vysokorychlostního open-source kodéru H.265/HEVC

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Google uvolnila prohlížeč Chrome 128 do stabilního kanálu pro platformy macOS, Windows a Linux. Přináší řadu nových funkcí včetně izolovaných webových aplikací, které rozšiřují stávající vlastnosti PWA, aby poskytovaly silnější zabezpečení/ochranu proti neoprávněné manipulaci.
articles.title: Chrome 128 s izolovanými webovými aplikacemi a standardizovaným zvětšováním v CSS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Grafické karty od Nvidie mají k dispozici zbrusu nový ovladač verze 560.35.03, u nějž Nvidia přechází na open-source jaderný základ ovladače, a to u generací GPU, pro které tento základ vyvíjí (starší nadále poběží s původním uzavřeným modulem). Na desktopu jsou tak i nadále podporovány grafické karty od GeForce GTX 750 (Ti) výše, notebookové od řady GeForce 800M výše.
articles.title: Vydán ovladač Nvidia 560 přecházející na otevřený základ

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Další nová verze CPU kodéru SVT-AV1 a další zrychlení. SVT-AV1 2.2 přináší další optimalizace parametrů kódování, které vedou k v průměru 15% zrychlení běhu s profily M0 až M8 při zachování téměř shodné vizuální kvality výstupu.
articles.title: Nová verze AV1 kodéru SVT-AV1 2.2 je o 15 % rychlejší

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývojáři GIMPu oznámili na X/Twitteru přechod do stádia String Freeze. Budoucí verze 3.0 tak má jasné textové popisy, které budou postupně dopřekládány do spousty jazyků a už se s nimi nebude hýbat. GIMP 3.0 je tak o krůček blíže vydání.
articles.title: Budoucí GIMP 3.0 má za sebou String Freeze, vydání zase o krok blíže

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Už jen posledních deset dní zbývá na přihlašování přednášek na letošní konferenci LinuxDays. Organizátory zajímají především témata týkající se Linuxu, open source, sítí, bezpečnosti, vývoje a podobně. Mezi návštěvníky jsou jak začátečníci, tak i velmi zkušení odborníci. Nemusíte se tedy bát přidat své téma.
articles.title: Posledních deset dnů pro přihlášení přednášky na LinuxDays 2024

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: jafaktnevim)
articles.description: Společnost Firaxis Games představila novou strategickou hru Civilization VII, která posouvá grafickou stránku a herní možnosti opět na vyšší úroveň. Města jsou fantastická, bitvy propracované. Lodě mohou nově plout i na řekách. Hudba úžasná. Uvidíme, co dalšího nám Civ VII přinese.
articles.title: Představená hra Civilization VII má slíbenou linuxovou podporu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Daniel Van Vugt z Canonicalu, jeden z předních vývojářů desktopu GNOME, pokračuje s řadou zajímavých patchů zasílaných do jádra. Předně se sluší zmínit, že tripple-buffering ještě nestihl projít kontrolou, a tak spíše lze očekávat, že do GNOME 47 to nestihne.
articles.title: Canonical / Ubuntu znovu zprovozňuje EGL pro Nvidii na Waylandu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Jan Grulich z Red Hatu zapracoval na podpoře běhu webových kamerek ve Firefoxu přes rozhraní PipeWire. Novinka si v rámci Red Hatího světa odbude premiéru s vydáním Fedory 41 v říjnu tohoto roku, kde bude PipeWire pro Firefox při obsluze webových kamerek výchozím rozhraním. A jak dodává Phoronix, práce je součástí širší snahy o přechod na PipeWire, plus implementaci podpory nové generace webkamerek s rozhraním Intel IPU6, což je mimo jiné práce Hanse de Goedeho.
articles.title: Fedora 41 bude pro webkameru ve Firefoxu používat PipeWire, finišuje podpora i pro Chromium

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Z pravidelného čtvrtletního reportu o novinkách v projektu FreeBSD plyne, že se hýbou ledy v oblasti AMD a oblíbený systém, který ostatně pohání Playstationy 4 a 5 s CPU/GPU AMD, by měl dostat lepší podporu. Kromě toho vývojáři FreeBSD pracují na spoustě dalších front, od OpenZFS, přes zvukový subsystém, portování Vector Packet Processoru (VPP) až po různá API.
articles.title: Spolupráce AMD a FreeBSD pro více než 256 CPU jader

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: O open source strategii v reálném čase Beyond All Reason (BAR) jsme tu před dvěma roky psali.  Je inspirovaná hrou Total Anihiliation z roku 1997.
articles.title: Open source RTS Beyond All Reason má nový trailer

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Zajímá vás moderní přístup ke službám a témata jako Docker, kontejnery, cloud, virtualizace a Kubernetes? Připravili jsme pro vás čtyřdenní kurz Docker s Kubernetes, na který můžete získat dotaci až 82 % od Úřadu práce. Kontaktujte naši kolegyni pavla.hettnerova@iinfo.cz.
articles.title: Čtyřdenní kurz Docker s Kubernetes dotovaný Úřadem práce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Dnes vyšlo Raspberry Pi 5 s 2 GB RAM. Jde o levnější variantu již prodávaných Raspberry Pi 5 s 4 a 8 GB RAM. Jednak se ušetřilo na menší paměti a také použitý SoC Broadcom BCM2712 má nový stepping D0. Funkčně je shodný s předchozím BCM2712, jen byl vynechán nepoužívaný křemík, čímž se také ušetřilo.
articles.title: Levnější Raspberry Pi 5 s 2 GB RAM

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Windows 11 Build 27686, který se dostal minulý čtvrtek do Insider kanálů, bude schopen formátovat oddíly FAT32  větší než 32 GB. Zatím tedy jen z příkazové řádky.
articles.title: Windows 11 budou nově moci formátovat FAT32 větší než 32 GB

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Ibrahim Al-Nasser ze Saúdské Arábie má Guinnessův rekord v co největším počtu herních konzolí připojených k jedinému televizoru. Připojeno jich bylo 444. Přitom použil více než 12 HDMI přepínačů a přes 30 cinch přepínačů pro starší konzole. Zatímco HDMI přepínače se automaticky propojí, stačí jen zapnout konzoli, s přepínáním cinchů je to složitější.
articles.title: Guinnessův rekord: 444 herních konzolí připojených k jedinému televizoru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Klasickou RPG Diablo včetně rozšíření Hellfire je možné hrát v prohlížeči díky projektu Diabloweb. Ten je založen na starším projektu Devilution.
articles.title: Diablo je možné hrát v prohlížeči

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Bývalí vývojáři Blizzardu vytvořili strategii v reálném čase Stormgate. Ta je nyní na Steamu v předběžném přístupu zdarma. Je sice jen pro Windows, ale podle všeho funguje dobře v Linuxu s Protonem 9.0–2.
articles.title: Bývalí vývojáři Blizzardu vytvořili RTS Stormgate, je v předběžném přístupu zdarma

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Uzavřený populární multiplatformní benchmark Geekbench pro Linux, macOS, Windows, Android a iOS patrně znáte. V roce 2013 se o něm nelichotivě vyjadřoval i Linus Torvalds. Nově byl včera vydán Geekbench AI 1.0, který testuje výkon pro zátěže typu umělé inteligence a strojového učení. Pro macOS, Linux a Windows jsou na oficiální stránce. Pro iOS a Android v obchodě s aplikacemi.
articles.title: Geekbench AI testuje rychlost vašeho počítače či telefonu pro AI

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: V letních měsících byly vydány aktualizace openSUSE Leap a SUSE, FreeBSD, Debianu, na testování zabezpečení zaměřených distribucí Kali a Parrot, dále např. IPFire, EasyOS, Tails či EndeavourOS.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 23-26/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: AI působí jako katalyzátor ransomwarových útoků, ale i jako jejich brzda. Hybridní již nejsou pouze cloudy, ale i sítě. Westcom 3D LAB demonstruje možnosti integrace bezpečnostních řešení více dodavatelů. Velké jazykové modely by mohly samy pro sebe generovat programy. A k čemu to může být dobré? Povede umělá inteligence k modernizaci finančních služeb?
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Hybridní již nejsou pouze cloudy, ale i sítě

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 33/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nový model umělé inteligence odhaluje skrytý jazyk DNA. Antropický princip a problém srovnávání nekonečen. Čeští vědci jako první viděli 3D strukturu organického materiálu staršího než Země.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Gravitační vlny by dokázaly prozradit používání warpových pohonů

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Ať už horečně hledáte levnou cestu k postavení hového počítače, nebo jen chcete upgradovat stárnoucí kopii Office, tato kolekce nabídky od Goodoffer24.com vám pomůže. Jejich ceny jsou opravdu neuvěřitelné, tak na co čekat?
articles.title: Oficiální cena za Windows 11 Pro je €259 avšak Goodoffer24 účtuje jen €20

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled červencových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za červenec 2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Řízení rizik může zpomalovat inovace, včetně zavádění AI. Konica Minolta se zaměřila na ochranu firemních dat. Teplotu elektroniky by mohly měřit neutrony, přesně a rychle. Nekonečně velká ochrana stojí nekonečně velké peníze. Průzkum Acronis hlásí 293% nárůst e-mailových útoků.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Teplotu elektroniky by mohly měřit neutrony, přesně a rychle

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 32/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Jak umělá inteligence pomáhá s průzkumem Marsu. Při zapamatování a vybavování se mozkové vlny šíří opačným směrem. Průlom ve vývoji ultrarychlých luminiscenčních materiálů. Kvantové tornádo má zlepšit naše chápání černých děr.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Data z CERNu dále omezují podmínky pro dlouho žijící supersymetrické částice

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Energetika a vodárenství zaznamenaly čtyřnásobné zvýšení průměrných nákladů na obnovu po ransomwaru. Technologie baterií (5): Vědci znovu zkusili baterie s vodou jako elektrolytem. Kam se v AddAI posunuli a kam směřují. Ness představuje Matrix, nástroj na efektivní agilní vývoj. Gordic představil nástroj pro signalizaci rizik u podepisovaných elektronických dokumentů.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Energetika a vodárenství zaznamenaly čtyřnásobné zvýšení průměrných nákladů na obnovu po ransomwaru

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 31/2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Forgejo, fork Gitei, tj. v programovacím jazyce Go naprogramovaná webová aplikace pro spolupráci na zdrojových kódech pomocí gitu, mění s verzí 9.0 licenci z MIT na GPLv3+.
articles.title: Forgejo mění licenci z MIT na GPLv3+

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Před 25 lety (𝕏, eArchiv Jiřího Peterky), 23. srpna 1999, byl spuštěn ARES (Administrativní registr ekonomických subjektů). Dnešní ARES.
articles.title: Před 25 lety byl spuštěn ARES (Administrativní registr ekonomických subjektů)

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Deno (Wikipedie), běhové prostředí (runtime) pro JavaScript, TypeScript a WebAssembly, bylo vydáno ve verzi 1.46. Jedná se o poslední 1.x verzi. V průběhu několika dnů vyjde první RC verze Deno 2 (Migration Guide).
articles.title: Deno 1.46, poslední 1.x verze

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Samsung na veletrhu Gamescom 2024 představil herní monitor Odyssey 3D umožňující 3D zobrazení bez brýlí.
articles.title: Samsung představil herní monitor Odyssey 3D umožňující 3D zobrazení bez brýlí

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: The Document Foundation oznámila vydání nové major verze 24.8 svobodného kancelářského balíku LibreOffice. Podrobný přehled nových vlastností i s náhledy v poznámkách k vydání (cs) a také na Youtube a PeerTube.
articles.title: LibreOffice 24.8

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Vývojáři KDE oznámili vydání balíku aplikací KDE Gear 24.08. Přehled novinek i s náhledy a videi v oficiálním oznámení.
articles.title: KDE Gear 24.08

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Vláda schválila návrh zákona o digitální ekonomice z dílny Ministerstva průmyslu a obchodu (MPO). Jeho cílem je chránit uživatele na internetu, připravit Českou republiku na přechod do nové digitální éry a zajistit bezpečné a spravedlivé digitální prostředí.
articles.title: Vláda schválila návrh zákona o digitální ekonomice

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Google Chrome 128 byl prohlášen za stabilní. Nejnovější stabilní verze 128.0.6613.84 přináší řadu novinek z hlediska uživatelů (Google Lens a Chat s Gemini) i vývojářů  (YouTube). Podrobný přehled v poznámkách k vydání. Opraveno bylo 38 bezpečnostních chyb. Vylepšeny byly také nástroje pro vývojáře.
articles.title: Google Chrome 128

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: LVFS (Linux Vendor Firmware Service) již 9 let umožňuje uživatelům Linuxu aktualizovat firmware na svých zařízeních. Za tuto dobu bylo staženo cca 110 milionů souborů s firmwary.
articles.title: LVFS již 9 let umožňuje uživatelům Linuxu aktualizovat firmware na svých zařízeních

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Po necelých třech letech bylo vydáno nové číslo magazínu Phrack: Phrack 71.
articles.title: Phrack 71

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Google Android engineers have shared a status update on bringing support for 16KB page size handling to Android. In moving from a 4KB to 16KB page size, Google has found a 5~10% performance boost but at the cost of around ~9% additional RAM usage...
articles.title: Google Making Progress On 16KB Page Size For Android

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Bochs Direct Rendering Manager (DRM) kernel driver is in the process of being modernized. The Bochs driver is important in that it's commonly used for virtual VGA output with QEMU for Linux virtualization...
articles.title: Bochs DRM Linux Driver Being Modernized - Better Performance For QEMU Display

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Vulkan 1.3.294 is out today with a handful of fixes and clarifications to this high performance graphics and compute API. In addition to the maintenance work, Vulkan 1.3.294 introduces a new pipeline binary extension: VK_KHR_pipeline_binary...
articles.title: Vulkan 1.3.294 Introduces New Pipeline Binary Extension

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel's open-source Linux graphics driver engineers continue feverishly working on the Xe2 graphics support both for imminently-launching Lunar Lake laptops and then the Battlemage discrete graphics cards. This week more "missing bits" were addressed in new Intel Linux graphics driver code on its way to DRM-Next ahead of the upcoming Linux 6.12 merge window...
articles.title: Intel Preps More Xe2 Lunar Lake & Battlemage Driver Code For Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A set of a dozen patches have reworked the video encode handling within Mesa 24.3 for the Video Acceleration (VA) front-end and the RadeonSI/VCN driver code. This rework aims to enable new features moving forward, enhance the overall driver, and bring "significant" memory savings for H.265/HEVC video encoding...
articles.title: Big Video Encoding Rework Lands For AMD Open-Source Mesa 24.3 Driver

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As part of catering to Google requirements around Google Chromebooks, AMD has been supporting Sound Open Firmware as the Intel-initiated open-source project across their APUs/SoCs. Sent out today was the patch for enabling ACP 7.0 SOF support for their newest SoCs like Strix Point to have Sound Open Firmware support...
articles.title: AMD Prepares Sound Open Firmware Driver For ACP7.0 Hardware

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: In addition to System76 software engineers being busy working on their new COSMIC desktop environment, on Thursday they also released a new version of the System76 Scheduler that is used by Pop!_OS...
articles.title: System76 Pop!_OS Scheduler Now Detects Hyprland, Lands Various Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While Bcachefs and Btrfs capture much of the Linux file-system spotlight these days when it comes to exciting developments, there is no shortage of alternative open-source file-systems. One that's been around for a long time but not seeing as much adoption or major feature developments but still worthy of a shout-out is the log-structured NILFS2 file-system. With the upcoming Linux 6.12 cycle it looks like it will land a fresh round of fixes and a few new ioctls being enabled...
articles.title: NILFS2 File-System Seeing More Fixes, Additional Ioctls Wired Up Ahead Of Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The upstream Linux "oxp-sensors" driver began as a driver for supporting the sensors on the OneXPlayer handheld. With time this driver has been extended to support more handheld gaming consoles and a new patch enables support for several more devices...
articles.title: Several Newer Gaming Handheld Devices To See Linux Sensor Monitoring Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: KDE Gear 24.08 has been released for this collection of KDE applications that pair with the Plasma desktop...
articles.title: KDE Gear 24.08 Brings Many App Enhancements & New Features

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the exception of critical security issues/bugs, Canonical will be skipping over shipping stable release updates for the Linux kernel in Ubuntu until early October...
articles.title: Ubuntu Will Be Skipping Non-Critical Linux Kernel Updates For September

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Mozilla Ocho group leads "innovation and experiments" at Mozilla. Following all of their work on Llamafile for easily distributing large language models as a single file that can be easily executed across different hardware/software, their newest effort is Whisperfile for easy audio-to-text translations...
articles.title: Mozilla Developing Whisperfile For Local Audio-To-Text Translation

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel software engineers are responsible for many of the great x86_64-related optimizations to the GNU C Library "glibc" over the years. While they've extensively tuned many Glibc functions for achieving peak performance on their modern CPUs, it's a never-ending quest. Merged this week was another optimization to strnlen(), the function for determining the number of bytes in a fixed-size string...
articles.title: Intel Further Speeds Up strnlen() In The GNU C Library For Recent Intel/AMD CPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While celebrating the 9th birthday of the Linux Vendor Firmware Service, LVFS/Fwupd lead developer Richard Hughes has released a new version of the Fwupd firmware updating utility...
articles.title: Fwupd 1.9.24 Adds Support For More Mediatek & Parade Tech Devices

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: LibreOffice 24.8 is officially out today as the latest major feature update to this open-source office suite that's the leading free software alternative to Microsoft Office. With LibreOffice 24.8 comes many new features throughout its various components...
articles.title: LibreOffice 24.8 Delivers Many Advancements To This Free Software Office Suite

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Google has promoted Chrome 128 to its stable channel across macOS, Windows, and Linux platforms...
articles.title: Chrome 128 Released With Isolated Web Apps, Standardized CSS Zoom

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel's uncore Linux platform driver is preparing for a new feature found on newer SoCs: ELC, or Efficiency Latency Control. This ELC feature for the Intel uncore handling allows fine tuning efficiency versus latency characteristics...
articles.title: Intel Uncore Linux Driver Prepares ELC "Efficiency Latency Control" Feature

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As part of Intel's Scalable Video Technology (SVT) initiative they had been developing SVT-HEVC as a BSD-licensed high performance H.265/HEVC video encoder optimized for Xeon Scalable and Xeon D processors. But recently they've changed course and the project has been officially discontinued...
articles.title: Intel Discontinues High-Speed, Open-Source H.265/HEVC Encoder Project

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: This week marks nine years since the Linux Vendor Firmware Service (LVFS) was started by Richard Hughes of Red Hat to ease the firmware updating/distribution process with the open-source Fwupd firmware updating utility...
articles.title: Over 9 Years LVFS Has Served Over 110 Million Firmware Files To Linux Systems

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Building off the prior NVIDIA 560 beta driver releases, the NVIDIA 560.35.03 stable Linux driver was released today for providing the latest official NVIDIA graphics/compute support for Linux systems...

Yes, that's it. Running dungeons gives you the largest amount of experience per hour, far exceeding any quest-specific leveling methods.

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
United Label and Odd Bug Studio have announced that Tails of Iron 2: Whiskers of Winter, the sequel to their 2021 action-RPG, will be released in February 2025 for PC and consoles. This is technically a delay from their planned 2024 release, but only slightly.


For some reason, rodents make the best fantasy protagonists, as proven by Redwall and Ghost of a Tale. Writing for Destructoid at the time, Chris Moyse gave the first Tails of Iron a 7.5 in a review laced with praise, calling it “one of the year’s most distinctive RPG experiences.”


Tails of Iron 2: Whiskers of Winter moves the action far to the north. You play as Arlo, “heir to the Warden of the Wastes.” The game is a sidescrolling, soulslike, dark fantasy game. After the Frog/Rat war, Bats rise up as a threat. Arlo has to travel the northern wastes in an effort to “Hunt down giant beasts. Unite disparate clans. Upgrade your settlement. And discover a terrible secret of blood and crown…” Rad.




Moyse’s review got me interested in Tails of Iron, but I have to be honest with you: it occupies this space that is high enough to make me consider buying it but low enough on my priorities where I’m not sure I’ll ever play it. The side-scroller genre is so packed these days. I can barely even look at a game with “metroidvania” in the description. I don’t hate these types of games; it’s just that I’ve played so many of them throughout my life that it’s hard to get excited. I don’t have time between games that have seized my attention anymore. Once I finish one, it’s onto another. Though, truly, I’m often playing multiple games in tandem; alternating between them.


What I’m saying is that Tails of Iron 2: Whiskers of Winter looks great. You should play it, and then I’ll live vicariously through your experience.


Tails of Iron 2 releases in February 2025 for Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, PS4, PS5, Switch, and PC.

The post Rodent-positive action-RPG Tails of Iron 2 releases in February appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Rodent-positive action-RPG Tails of Iron 2 releases in February

articles.author: Darrus Myles
articles.description:
In WoW: The War Within, Brax, the Innkeeper of Gundargaz, The Ringing Deeps, has lost his trusty pair of Brass Knuckles and tasks you to retrieve them. The only problem is, the area where he wants you to search is huge, so here's exactly where you can find them.


Where is Brax's Brass Knuckles in WoW: The War Within?


Despite the enormous search area, Brax's Brass Knuckles aren't as difficult to find as the quest makes them appear. When I first looked at the map, I assumed it would be a small, interactable object hidden somewhere in the vast quest area that I'd need to keep an eye out for. Turns out, it's nothing like that. Brax's Brass Knuckles were picked up by one of the various fungal lifeforms roaming The Ringing Deeps. This quest is a 'kill and loot' quest in disguise, as all you need to do to actually find his knuckles is slay a whole bunch of them.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Specifically, the enemies you want to look for are all plant life in The Ringing Deeps. The ones you want to keep a look out for are the following:



Underdrip Crwaler


Crawler Sproutling


Disturbed Kelp


Disrupted Slime


Sweetnuffler


Creeping Lashroom



All these beasts can be found roaming the questing area, and defeating them gives you a good chance of finding Brax's Brass Knuckles on their corpse. From my experience, the drop rate seems fairly high—you’re likely to get them within 10 kills. Once you’ve acquired the knuckles, you'll still need to complete the second part of Brax's quest to turn them in, but this should help you get past the most unpredictable step of the process.

The post Where to find Brax’s Brass Knuckles in WoW: The War Within appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Where to find Brax’s Brass Knuckles in WoW: The War Within

articles.author: Darrus Myles
articles.description:
With Hero Talents being one of WoW: The War Within's main features, it's natural to want to unlock them as soon as possible. If you're jumping into new expansion now, here's everything you need to know about the process.


How to get Hero Talents in WoW: The War Within


When you enter the game with the expansion enabled, if open your Talent Tree, you'll see a third new tree in the middle of the screen. These are your Hero Talents, but they are locked until you meet two key conditions, neither of which are difficult to achieve. 


To unlock them, make sure you have The War Within purchased and have begun the new campaign questline.  The campaign takes you to the ancient lands of Khaz Algar, and you're required to go there to unlock your Hero Talent tree.


Screenshot by Destructoid


After that, all you need to do is reach level 71, and the new talents will automatically unlock. Simply questing in The War Within should provide more than enough experience to get you there. As you level up from 70 to 80, you’ll earn one Hero Talent point per level, which can only be used on the Hero Talent tree of your choice. 


Unlike previous new systems in WoW, there’s no additional questline, trigger, or condition needed to unlock these talents, which is a bit surprising. Still, by following these two straightforward steps, you’ll be able to fully enjoy the new Hero Talents. Like normal talents, Hero Talents can be respecced free of charge, so feel free to play around with and experiment with your class's new powers.

The post How to unlock Hero Talents in WoW: The War Within appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to unlock Hero Talents in WoW: The War Within

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Sega was a big player in the arcade industry during the ‘80s, but they had trouble breaking into the home console market. The Master System was mired in difficulties, but almost through sheer marketing, it was able to make a sizeable dent in the North American market with the Sega Genesis in 1989.


Mine was a Nintendo household growing up. But surprisingly, in my youthful days on the schoolyard, we never really argued about what was the better console between the Super Nintendo and Sega Genesis. I don’t know why. It just didn’t matter at my school. Besides, I was spending a lot of time on my cousin’s Genesis right around the corner.


Over the past couple of decades, I’ve grown an affection for Sega’s classic console, helped in part by the distinctive tones of its FM Synth sound chip. The…
articles.title: Top 10 Best Sega Genesis games, ranked

articles.author: Randy Marr
articles.description:
Pet collectors of World of Warcraft have a relatively unique way to earn a new pet starting today. All they have to do is stream their World of Warcraft adventures to their friends in Discord. 


After 15 minutes of streaming WoW to their pals, players will be eligible to claim this pet. This promotion is running until September 8.


For those who haven't seen these before, Discord has a quest system that lets you claim rewards for certain games. It's a fancy promotional tool, but one that can let players nab unique rewards. In Discord, you can view Quests under the Discover tab; find the quest you want, and select Accept.


Once you've accepted the quest, stream World of Warcraft to at least one other person for 15 minutes. Once you're done, you can claim your reward from the quest page. In this case, it's a unique pet. Parrlok is a chunky little cyclopean ogre with a distinct sort of charm. It's a one-of-a-kind pet, as the only other like it is a recolored pet named Garrlok. That one has only been offered in the Trading Post, so there's currently no way to get it unless he cycles back in.


Image by Destructoid


Parrlok isn't just for looks, though. He's a potential new member of your Battle Pet team as well. He's a humanoid with decent health stats, and comes with "Cute as a Button." It's a rare skill for Humanoid battle pets to have, increasing their dodge chance to 33% for 2 rounds. Combined with "Stoneskin," he's quite the little tank.


World of Warcraft: The War Within is available for early access now, and releases on August 26 worldwide. You can check out all of our continuing guides and coverage here.

The post Get an exclusive Parrlok pet in World of Warcraft by streaming on Discord appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Get an exclusive Parrlok pet in World of Warcraft by streaming on Discord

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
After almost two years, the sandbox adventure game Core Keeper will finally come out of Early Access. With its full launch, there are plenty of new features to behold, unraveling the secrets of the ancient Core. We're here to dig into Core Keeper 1.0's release date and unveil upcoming content.


Core Keeper 1.0 release date and features


Core Keeper 1.0 will be released on Aug. 27, 2024. This date also marks the game's official console debut, including PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and Xbox One. According to the Nintendo page, the title will also launch on the Switch on Sept. 17, 2024.


The Core Keeper 1.0 content reveal trailer confirms a new and customizable world generation feature, allowing you to explore your favorite biomes. Plus, you can try out the two new combat styles: Warlock and Mage. Explore a unique magic system that requires the power of mana and unlock additional skills for character builds. You'll also uncover a new talent tree for Magic and Summoning, which helps with attack damage and mana regeneration. 




The developer, Pugstorm, has given us the deets on Core Keeper's co-op and cross-platform availability. While online multiplayer continues to be worked upon, there are no plans for local co-op or cross-platform support. On the other hand, multiplayer will be revamped for PC crossplay as the team looks into the new PlayFab Party.


If you've played Core Keeper in Early Access, Pugstorm recommends starting a new world to make the 1.0 experience run smoothly. Any old worlds will be renamed as "Classic," indicating that it is an unsupported version for the full release. You can still access these builds afterward, but they won't include 1.0 content.


Image via Pugstorm


Once Core Keeper 1.0 arrives, more updates will roll out to expand the magical universe. That means you can anticipate new content and quality-of-life improvements in the near future.

The post When does Core Keeper 1.0 come out? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: When does Core Keeper 1.0 come out?
