articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's Liberty Falls cinematic unveils an exclusive first look at Edward Richtofen's return, bringing the Wunderwaffe along for the ride. 


The cinematic begins with a nightmarish series of events as Richtofen horrifically dreams about death and destruction. If you've been a longtime fan of the Black Ops series, you'll likely notice the familiar voice talents of Nolan North. Although his role hasn't been confirmed yet, fans are already buzzing in the comments about his return. His comeback isn't too surprising, given that North has been teasing Richtofen's comeback. 




Once Edwards wakes from the nightmare, we return to the early '90s and step into the upcoming Liberty Falls map. Like all Zombies storylines, things go haywire when a mysterious entity threatens the world. The classic Wunderwaffe makes its grand appearance here, as Richtofen uses it to electrify the undead. This sneak peek confirms at least Wonder Weapon for Black Ops 6, but there will undoubtedly be more.


As a longtime Black Ops fan, seeing Edward Richtofen through the lens of modern graphics is certainly a sight to behold. And having Nolan North voice him again makes it even more epic, bringing me back to the days when I first saw the character in Origins.


While Richtofen looks to be the "hero" of the Liberty Falls cinematic, the Terminus Team, the playable crew of Black Ops 6, think otherwise. The Terminus trailer indicates that Edward will be the main target of the BO6 Zombies saga as a plot to seek revenge. He has done plenty of wrongdoings in previous entries, so now his past is finally catching up to him. 


There's still a lot of mystery surrounding the Black Ops 6 Zombies story, but fortunately, the upcoming CoD Next event offers more insight into this. So, if you want some more Richtofen, tune into the event on Aug. 28 to get ready for BO6's Beta release.  

The post Richtofen and Wunderwaffe take the stage in CoD: Black Ops 6 Liberty Falls cinematic appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Richtofen and Wunderwaffe take the stage in CoD: Black Ops 6 Liberty Falls cinematic

articles.author: Moulik Mathur
articles.description:
Trading Posts or Trade Outposts in No Man’s Sky are present on planets in all star systems with lifeforms. They serve a variety of purposes and are a good pitstop to buy and sell items using a Galactic Trade Terminal, like the one you find in Space Stations.


However, trading posts are not useful if you need resources in bulk, as you won’t find as much quantity here as you would at a space station. However, rarer resources will be found at a Galatic Trade Terminal here, as compared to the ones on a Space Station, and for a lower price to boot.


With seven Landing Pads available, Trading Posts may serve as a decent spot to go starship-hunting and finally stumble upon an elusive S-class starship which you may have been tirelessly looking for in the game.


Image via Hello Games


You may find Trading Posts by simply exploring a planet and discovering it from a distance, but that’s down to pure luck since planets in No Man’s Sky are massive. A much simpler and more effective way is to install an Economy Scanner in your starship, which lets you access the quick menu when in the starship to find a nearby trading post on the planet.


There are other ways to find a Trading Post, but the Economy Scanner is the only guaranteed way to locate them. If you cannot build an Economy Scanner, you can use a Planetary Chart (inhabited outpost) or a Signal Booster, but both will reveal information on any kind of structure, making them a trial-and-error method.


One more sneaky suggestion: Sometimes, you may find starships in a planet’s atmosphere that are not heading out towards space. If you follow these starships, they may also lead you to a trading post.

The post How to find Trading Post in No Man’s Sky appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to find Trading Post in No Man’s Sky

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
With the World of Warcraft: The War Within expansion, we've received a whole new questline as well as achievements for completing the narratives in all four new zones in Khaz Algar. However, you may notice that despite finishing the available quests, they aren't all registering as completed. Here is how to complete the Brotherhood in the Skolzgal Wood questline in The War Within.





How to do the Brotherhood in the Skolzgal Wood questline for the Sojourner of Isle of Dorn achievement


One of the steps for the Sojourner of the Isle of Dorn achievement in The War Within is to complete the Brotherhood in the Skolzgal Wood questline. Despite the Isle of Dorn being the first zone in the expansion, and accessible at Level 70, you can't actually do this quest until you are the next max Level of 80.


Once you reach Level 80, head back to the Isle of Dorn, and more specifically the Crossroads Plaza at coordinates X: 55.36, Y:55.80 and you will see an Earthen citizen named Dornogal Citizen who has the quest A Sassy Arathi. This is the start of the Brotherhood in the Skolzgal Wood questline, and how you can complete it and unlock the Sojourner of Isle of Dorn achievement.


All Brotherhood in the Skolzgal Wood quest


In total there are a dozen quests you will need to complete to fully finish the Brotherhood in the Skolzgal Wood questline for the Sojourner of the Isle of Dorn achievement. Here are all of the quests in order that you will need to complete:



A Sassy Arathi


An Oddball in Dornogal


Found Around the Unbound


The Pillage of Freywold Village


The Abductors' Obstructors


Holy Fire in Rambleshirie


A Time to Kill at the Lumber Mill


Ungirthin' the Earthen


Concealed in the Weald


A Lamplight for the Shipwright


Up to No Good Down in Silkwood


Best Friends Same Ends



Upon completing Best Friends Same Ends, you will complete the Brotherhood in the Skolzgal Wood questline.

The post How to complete Brotherhood in the Skolzgal Wood questline in WoW The War Within appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to complete Brotherhood in the Skolzgal Wood questline in WoW The War Within

articles.author: Moulik Mathur
articles.description:
Corrupted Sentinels are tougher than your average Sentinel in No Man's Sky, and usually you might want to avoid them. The current Expedition, though, asks you to hunt down 32 of these enemies. How do you find them? Let's talk about it.


Corrupted Sentinels in No Man’s Sky can be found on planets that are a part of Dissonant star systems. You may also find Corrupted Sentinels randomly attacking your Planetary Settlement, or you may run into them near Salvageable Scrap dig sites. However, the sure shot way is to find a Dissonant star system.


Players who are looking to find Corrupted Sentinels specifically to hunt them down for the Liquidators expedition should first finish setting up their Minotaur Exocraft, and should pilot the Minotaur to defeat the Corrupted Sentinels. This way, they w…
articles.title: How to find Corrupted Sentinels in No Man’s Sky

articles.author: Randy Marr
articles.description:
An unexpected update was recently released for Vampire Survivors, with a surprising amount of content. It contains the first few cards in the new "Dark Arcana," serving as the groundwork for some incredibly powerful abilities.


There's more: A new stage, some new secrets, and a new character are also awaiting you. We're here to make sure you know how to find and unlock everything in Vampire Survivors' Darkasso update.


How to unlock the new stage


The first thing you'll need to start on the path to unlocking everything is the new stage. While the clue might be obvious, we'll still explain the details. The stage unlocks when you "cast a spell" called "forbiddenbox." As long as you've collected the Forbidden Scrolls of Morbane, you'll have a main menu option called "Secrets." Go there, an…
articles.title: How to unlock everything in the Vampire Survivors Darkasso update

articles.description:
The EA FC 24 Pre-Season Re-Release Team 1 is now live in Ultimate Team. This release includes several amazing cards that were released in earlier months as part of older promos. This is the final chance for the community to pack these cards and use them in their teams. Naturally, the odds of finding them in different packs will be a lot higher as well. 


Disclaimer: List to be updated. As of writing, there are lot more special cards than the ones mentioned here, including items present as part of EA FC 24 FUTTIES Best of Re-Release Batch 3. 


Complete list of EA FC 24 Pre-Season Re-Release Team 1 cards


These cards include some of the best-rated items released in Ultimate Team. You can find them in any pack that contains Rare Gold Players. The first batch also includes some of the best …
articles.title: All EA FC 24 Pre-Season Re-Release Team 1 players

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Skydevilpalm has announced that the long-anticipated racing game Victory Heat Rally, finally has a release date. It will be out on PC October 3, 2024. And also mobile via the Crunchyroll Game Vault if you’re into that sort of thing.


Victory Heat Rally is a high-speed arcade racing game based on Sega’s quasi-3D super-scaler games like Power Drift. It’s also, last I checked, absolutely fantastic. I played the demo about a year ago. I came away several steps above impressed; somewhere in the realm of “enthusiastic.” It’s fast, colorful, and packed with personality.




It’s been a long time coming. It had a successful Kickstarter campaign back in 2020, but development was a bit slow. It’s a small team, and the primary developer had a child, leading to them trying to adopt a healthier work/life balance. A release window was announced for Winter 2024, so it's going to be a bit early. But what can you do? Game development can be unpredictable.


I’m happy to see its impending release. There is a complete dearth of arcade-style racing games these days. Some are arriving that cop a feel from Saturn and PS1 games. However, pre-3D racing games are among my favorite takes on the genre. I’ll be really jazzed if someone makes a new cross-country title like Rad Mobile.


Victory Heat Rally releases on PC October 3, 2024.

The post Super Scaler inspired racing game Victory Heat Rally is out in October appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Super Scaler inspired racing game Victory Heat Rally is out in October

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
There are many meals in Disney Dreamlight Valley, and more are added with every update. Because of this, it can be hard to figure out what’s worth cooking, especially depending on whether you’re trying to cook for profit or use your meals for energy. 


Whether you’re looking to restore some energy for tasks around the Valley or you want to make a quick buck, I’ve narrowed down the 10 best meals for each purpose. I’m going to split the base game recipes from any Rift in Time DLC recipes, but give 10 of each so that you’ve got all your bases covered whether you have the DLC or not.


The best recipes for making Star Coins in Disney Dreamlight Valley


Screenshot by Destructoid


If you’re looking to make some money and happen to have a stockpile of ingredients or don’t mind foraging and far…
articles.title: 10 best meals for Energy or Star Coins in Disney Dreamlight Valley

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
For a game that's been vaguely on the horizon for as long as STALKER 2, it sure is surprising to see it taking up such a wonderfully nostalgic shape. As if that wasn't enticing enough, we now have confirmation that one of the prior games' protagonists is coming back: Scar!


That's right: STALKER: Clear Sky's playable character, Scar, appears not to have been zombified at the end of the original STALKER's standalone expansion pack and narrative prequel. Instead, he's quite lively in STALKER 2, as depicted in the latest trailer released by GSC Game World. Although this particular trailer won't be quite as fascinating to franchise newcomers as some of the other ones might've been, it is just the sort of thing veterans will be on the lookout for. Check it out:




Clear Sky protagonist Scar i…
articles.title: A fan-favorite Clear Sky character returns in STALKER 2, new trailer reveals

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
Development in key in Madden 25's Franchise mode, and that's true for your players and staff members alike. 


Just like your players, your staff members can also be improved as the seasons progress. You can use Staff Points to unlock new abilities . Now there's plenty of options, but it's always more efficient to pinpoint your choices. This will not only save your resources, but your staff members will improve faster. 


Best coach abilities to unlock in Madden 25


It's important to first note that all abilities have specific use-scenario. No ability that you unlock after an upgrade will be useless, but some are just better than the remaining ones. 


Ability
Effect




Secret Stuff
Decreases the time required to heal multi-week injuries


After School Tutoring
Access additional focus player for weekly strategy


Steady Hands
Increased XP gamins for WRs in training


The Final Piece
All players count as scheme fits in training


Iron Nerves (OC)
Boost QB's ability to throw under pressure


On Line One (Player Personnel)
Guaranteed trade package for current user pick during draft


Quite the Sales Pitch (Player Personnel)
Non X-Factor players will be valued at higher development trait than actual


Scheme Fits (Player Personnel)
Free agents who fit team schemes will have increased interest to sign for your team






Most of the head coaches will already have some nodes either fully unlocked or requiring partial upgrades. In my save with the Houston Texans, both the Offensive and Defensive coordinators come with practically clean slates. Hence, they're the ones who will require more upgrades and Staff Points.


Do note that even some of the relatively basic abilities can be very useful. Some of them have two or three tiers which will make them even more efficient.

The post Best staff upgrades in Madden 25 Franchise mode appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Best staff upgrades in Madden 25 Franchise mode

After wrapping up Disney Dreamlight Valley's Rift in Time expansion, you'll work with Jafar to discover why Eternity Isle has random 2D objects appearing. Over time, he'll conduct multiple alchemical experiments, with the Serpent's Gift quest diving deeper into his discoveries.


Disney Dreamlight Valley The Serpent's Gift quest guide


The Serpent's Gift is a quest you'll unlock after reaching friendship level seven with Jafar. After reaching level seven and speaking to Jafar, he'll tell you about a discovery he made during his latest alchemical experiments. Following the conversation, he'll give you four Imagination Generators to place in the following locations:



The Lagoon


The Borderlands


The Docks


In front of Oswald's house



You'll need to take a quick trip to Eternity Isle …
articles.title: How to complete The Serpent’s Gift quest in Disney Dreamlight Valley

articles.author: Christine Choi
articles.description:
Genshin Impact  comes with several banners you can wish on to obtain rare characters and weapons. Each banner is a different type of slot machine, and understanding their probabilities is key to avoiding disappointment.


This article is part of a series on Genshin Impact’s convoluted gacha system. It’s important to understand exactly what you’re getting into when you engage with predatory gambling mechanics like these. By knowing your chances, you can get a realistic idea of what to expect from your pulls and make smarter decisions when spending your precious Primogems.


Genshin Impact wishes, explained


The standard banner is a great place to start learning about Genshin Impact’s complicated wishing system. The character and weapon banners function similarly, with small differences. Th…
articles.title: Genshin Impact wishes explained: the standard banner

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Taiwan's Criminal Investigation Bureau (CIB) has carried out a successful raid against a pirate IPTV provider that had been capturing broadcasters' content for at least two years. Authorities say the operation was hidden in a house with an outward appearance of being abandoned years ago. Among 279 items seized were 72 set-top boxes, 72 video encoders, servers, networking hardware, bank books, and mobile phones.  Two suspects were arrested.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate IPTV Raid: 150+ Encoders, STBs, and Servers Seized, Operators Arrested

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
In Germany, several large Internet service providers are blocking notorious pirate sites. These actions are the result of a voluntary agreement with rightsholders, under which the affected domain names can't be named. A 17-year-old student isn't keen on this secrecy and, together with some friends, has released a dedicated portal exposing all blocked domains to the public.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: 17-Year-old Student Exposes Germany’s ‘Secret’ Pirate Site Blocklist

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Offering movies and TV shows at no cost to the consumer has seen 'FAST' services like Pluto TV attract tens of millions of users. Consumption is also thriving via unofficial methods, including M3U8 playlists that are versatile despite their simplicity. During the past 24 hours, the most popular unofficial playlists were taken offline by Warner Bros, succeeding where earlier attempts failed.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Unofficial M3U8 Playlists For Pluto TV, Samsung & Plex, Shut Down By Warner

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
In June, Webtoon Entertainment celebrated going public by sounding the closing bell at the Nasdaq exchange. Thus far, early investors haven't been rewarded, but the company itself sees a bright future ahead. By targeting roughly 170 pirate site domains though a DMCA subpoena, it hopes to unmask their rogue operators and clear the path for future growth.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Webtoon Targets 170+ Pirate Domains Through DMCA Subpoena

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Kakao Entertainment's pursuit of pirates distributing the company's 'webtoon' comics has been controversial at times, yet appears to be delivering results. Earlier this year the company's P.Cok anti-piracy unit offered rewards for webtoon fans to snitch on pirates. With the release of Kakao's fifth anti-piracy report, the company details its successes and reveals legal action targeting three major manga sites.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Kakao Reveals Anti-Piracy Successes, Legal Action Against Major Manga Sites

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
This November, The Pirate Bay will make its debut as a TV series on Swedish public television. The dramatized version of the site's history will be a trip down memory lane for those who followed the site closely over the years. This includes the 'classic' responses to legal threats, one of which features prominently in a just-launched teaser.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: “The Pirate Bay” TV Series Teaser Appears Online

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Bypass Paywalls Clean, a popular browser extension that allows users to view subscription websites without a subscription, has been shut down along with 3,879 forks. In a takedown notice filed at GitHub, News Media Alliance, which represents 2,200 news, magazine, and digital media publishers, explains that BPC violates its members rights under the DMCA's anti-circumvention provisions.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Bypass Paywalls Clean Shut Down For DMCA Anti-Circumvention Violations

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Creative Content Australia has new anti-piracy campaign underway alongside the release of its annual Piracy Behaviors and Attitudes survey. In line with current anti-piracy trends, the group hopes to draw attention to the downsides of using pirate sites. "More than two million Australians who admit to visiting illegal streaming sites or pirate sites say they’ve experienced a form of online crime." Let's take a closer look.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Aussie Piracy Survey: ‘Poor Picture’ & ‘Slow Device’ = Cybersecurity Issues

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
U.S. law enforcement authorities appear to have seized several domain names of live sports streaming site Streameast, which is particularly popular in America. A seizure banner accuses the operation of criminal activity and warns of prison sentences. Nevertheless, the site's operators have already made a restart and are vowing to keep going until sports streams are affordable for everyone.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Feds Seize Domain Names of Sports Streaming Site Streameast

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'Twisters' tops the chart, followed by 'Jackpot!'. 'Fly Me To The Moon' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 08/19/2024

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Almost two years after Radiohead released 'In Rainbows' as a pay-what-you-like album, the track 'These Are My Twisted Words' leaked on private torrent site What.cd. Many believed that the band itself was responsible, something we highlighted in our August 2009 article. Coinciding almost perfectly with the leak's 15-year anniversary, a complaint filed with Google now claims that the report violates copyright law and must be permanently deindexed from search results.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Radiohead ‘Leaked’ Their Own Track in 2009, Now We’re Accused of Pirating It

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
NVIDIA sits front and center of the AI boom. The company provides the much-needed chips and offers its own AI models. NVIDIA admittedly used pirated books to train these models, which triggered a copyright infringement lawsuit. This week, the company informed the court that these claims fall flat, arguing that copyrighted books are nothing more than statistical correlations to its AI models.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: NVIDIA: Copyrighted Books Are Just Statistical Correlations to Our AI Models

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
In December 2022, music industry giants including BMG, UMG, and Capitol, filed a massive copyright infringement lawsuit against Altice, owners of internet service provider Optimum. The complaint followed the familiar 'repeat infringer' format, with damages for works in suit worth over a billion dollars and everything on the line. A joint filing this week reveals that the lawsuit has been dismissed with prejudice, never to see the light of day again.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Billion Dollar Music Piracy Lawsuit Against Optimum is Over, Permanently

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Larissa Knapp, the MPA's new Chief Content Protection Officer, and the team at ACE have announced the shutdown of several US-based pirate IPTV services. The FBI veteran revealed the closure of AnytimeTV plus other pirate brands, and a settlement with three operators worth over $2m. After appearing to disregard the importance of security, shutting down now may have helped to avoid a larger bill, further down the road.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ACE Shuts US-Based Pirate IPTV Services, Poor Security Costs $2m

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Cox Communications has filed a petition at the Supreme Court, requesting a review of a Fourth Circuit ruling that held the company liable for pirating subscribers. While the case is ultimately about service provider liability, the ISP stresses that the current verdict jeopardizes internet access for all Americans, and threatens to cause mass disruption across the internet.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Cox Asks Supreme Court to Protect Internet Subscribers from ‘Piracy Terminations’

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
After years of legal proceedings, New Zealand Justice Minister Paul Goldsmith has approved Kim Dotcom's extradition to the United States. The Megaaupload founder faces criminal copyright infringement, racketeering, and money laundering charges, which in theory could lead to decades in prison. Dotcom says he has a plan and doesn't intend to leave the country.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Kim Dotcom’s Extradition to the U.S. Given Green Light By New Zealand

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
In the unlikely event that there's anyone left in the UK who hasn't been completely desensitized to the perils of IPTV, here's another case to strain the nerves. After being raided five years ago, two brothers from Ilford in Essex have been sentenced to prison. Whether both will actually see the inside of a cell is unclear; one turned up to face the music, the other failed to appear. The reason for his absence is unknown and just the start of a long list of other unanswered questions.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Two IPTV Pirates Sentenced to Prison But After 5 Years Questions Remain

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Popular shadow library LibGen appears to be struggling with technical problems. Regular book downloads stopped working last weekend and remain unavailable. The reason for the issues are unknown but, for now, internal troubles at the site seem more likely than a copyright-related enforcement action.  
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Popular Shadow Library ‘LibGen’ Breaks Down Amidst Legal Troubles (Updated)

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
File-hosting service Uptobox was taken offline last year following complaints from entertainment industry giants including Amazon, Disney, and StudioCanal. The platform's servers were targeted in a police raid just months after a French court ordered ISPs to block the site. Uptobox tried to reverse this decision, arguing that it's not the piracy haven rightsholders make it out to be, but the court denied that challenge.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Uptobox Bid to Resurrect File-Storage Service Fails in French Court
